The Agentic Shift

February 27, 2026 ‚Ä¢ The Future of PMM
Welcome to Week Three

Quick ask before we dive in: We've had limited response to our internal AI tools survey, and even less to the Gartner PMM survey. Both are shaping important decisions ‚Äî your input genuinely matters. If you haven't taken 5 minutes to fill them out, please do. Links at the bottom.

Now, onto this week's focus: the agentic shift ‚Äî and what it means when your buyer stops being a person and starts being an algorithm.

I've been thinking about this for months, but this week I finally wrote it down: the uncomfortable truth that everything we assume about product marketing ‚Äî personas, messaging hierarchies, content-to-conversion pipelines ‚Äî breaks when an AI agent is doing the evaluation.

Plus: meet this week's User of the Week ‚Äî Soo Shim, whose BattleCoach prototype shows what competitive intelligence looks like when it's designed for scale.

‚ÄîChris

Featured

Your Buyer Just Hired an Agent. Now What?

Here's the uncomfortable truth most product marketers haven't internalized yet: your buyer is disappearing. Not literally ‚Äî but increasingly, humans are deploying agents to do the work that used to land them on your website.

What This Essay Covers:

  • Why the old frameworks are broken ‚Äî personas, SEO, content marketing all assumed human discovery patterns
  • The K-shaped future ‚Äî the widening gap between AI-native PMMs and everyone else
  • Discoverability as the new battleground ‚Äî what happens when agents don't use Google
  • MCP vs. end-to-end activation ‚Äî two strategic paths forward

User of the Week
üèÜ User of the Week

Hyunsoo "Soo" Shim

Senior Director, Global Competitive Intelligence ¬∑ SAP

Building BattleCoach ‚Äî an agentic AI prototype that transforms static competitive content into dynamic coaching for sellers. The insight that sparked it: "Our competitive messaging often fails the logo swap test." If you can swap your logo for a competitor's and the messaging still works, you don't have differentiation.

Her approach: A 3-day workshop to create 9 solution-level playbooks (3 buying scenarios √ó 3 competitors), then encode that intelligence into an AI system that can scale.

News Roundup

This Week in AI + PMM

üì¢ OpenAI Turns ChatGPT Into an Ad Platform

800 million users just became the product. OpenAI's February announcement validated what many predicted: every AI assistant builder is now an ad company.

PMM takeaway: Your brand's presence in AI-mediated conversations just became a paid media question.

ü§ñ Salesforce Spring 2026: AI Agents Across CRM

Salesforce expanded Agentforce with new autonomous agents for marketing, sales, and service. The agents can now handle multi-step workflows without human intervention.

PMM takeaway: The race to embed agentic capabilities into enterprise software is officially on.

üõí Google Announces AI Mode Checkout Protocols

Google introduced standards allowing AI agents to complete purchases directly within its ecosystem. Buyer agents can now transact without human involvement.

PMM takeaway: If your checkout flow isn't agent-friendly, you're invisible.

‚ö∞Ô∏è B2BMX 2026: The "Infinite Content Graveyard"

The Demand Gen Report's conference preview says it plainly: "AI-powered is no longer a differentiator‚Äîit's the baseline." Every whitepaper sounds the same.

PMM takeaway: The new question isn't "are you using AI?" ‚Äî it's "what actually breaks through?"

üè¢ Oracle Launches Role-Based AI Agents

New role-based agents for marketers, sellers, and CS teams can pull context from across Fusion applications.

PMM takeaway: The agent wars are heating up. SAP, Salesforce, Oracle‚Äîeveryone's shipping.
